snippet: Ed Miliband, the Labour leader, proposed replacing the House of Lords, which traces its roots to the 14th century, with an American-style elected Senate.
abstract: Ed Miliband, leader of Britain's opposition Labour Party, proposes replacing the House of Lords, which traces its roots to the 14th century, with an American-style elected Senate; stresses that the House of Lords is not geographically representative of the United Kingdom, with London having more members than Wales, Northern Ireland, East and West Midland and Yorkshire combined.
lead_paragraph: Ed Miliband, the Labour leader, proposed replacing the House of Lords, which traces its roots to the 14th century, with an American-style elected Senate.

headline.main: Labour Party Leader Backs Replacing House of Lords
headline.print_headline: Labour Party Leader Backs Replacing House of Lords
